intro: Plagiogyria dunnii, commonly known as the dwarf rock cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, rosette-forming, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Plagiogyria dunnii produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, contributing to its ornamental appeal in alpine gardens.
